blocks.text: Viruses attach themselves to legitimate files and spread when those files are executed. Worms, by contrast, spread independently across networks without user interaction.
Indicators of virus infections may include corrupted files, unexplained application crashes, or unexpected changes to system behavior.
Worm outbreaks often produce rapid network congestion, high CPU usage, and large volumes of scanning traffic as the worm searches for new targets.
Early detection is important because worms can propagate extremely quickly across unpatched systems, overwhelming networks and servers.
